Used to deposit the underlying asset into the channel and converts it into cToken (ex: deposit DAI for a cDAI channel)
   * @param _amount             The amount of underlying token to be added to the channel
Emergency function that is to be called if the recipient doesn't call the close function before the specified endTime
Repays the borrowed underlying asset of the channel if an allowance has been set for the channel contract

Withdraws the Ether that was used to borrow against once the debt has been repaid
   * @param _cEth           cToken address of the token that was supplied

Extends the end time of the channel to a further date if proposed by the sender and the new time is greater than the currenct end time
   * @param _newTime         Proposed new end time

Used to deposit the underlying asset into the channel and converts it into cToken (ex: deposit DAI for a cDAI channel)
   * @param _amount             The amount of underlying token to be added to the channel
Emergency function that is to be called if the recipient doesn't call the close function before the specified endTime
Repays the borrowed underlying asset of the channel if an allowance has been set for the channel contract

Withdraws the Ether that was used to borrow against once the debt has been repaid
   * @param _cEth           cToken address of the token that was supplied

params._cTokenGive: cToken address of the token that is provided to borrow against
params._getAmount: How much of the underlying token they would like to receive
params._giveAmount: The amount of the provided to token that they are willing to supply
params._tokenGive: ERC20 address that is provided to borrow against

params._getAmount: How much of the underlying token they would like to receive

params._amount: The amount of underlying token that was signed to the recipient
params._signature: Sig that was created to the recipient for a specific amount

params._amount: The amount of underlying token to be added to the channel

params._cTokenAddress: Address of the cToken for the channel (ex: cDAI Address)
params._endTime: Time in unix when the channel can be forced closed
params._factoryAddress: The address of the factory that created the channel
params._recipient: Address that will recieve some of the funds when channel is closed
params._sender: Address that will be depositing funds into the channel
params._tokenAddress: Address of the underlying token for the channel (ex: DAI Address)

params._cTokenGave: cToken address of the token that was supplied
params._tokenGave: ERC20 token address of the token that was supplied

params._cEth: cToken address of the token that was supplied

borrowERC20AgainstERC20(address,address,.notice: Allows someone to borrow the underlying ERC20 token of the channel from Compound against a different Compound ERC20 asset

borrowERC20AgainstETH(address,uint256,ad.notice: Allows someone to borrow the underlying ERC20 token of the channel from Compound against a Ether

close(uint256,bytes).notice: Called by the recipient when they would like to recieve their payment

depositERC20(uint256).notice: Used to deposit the underlying asset into the channel and converts it into cToken (ex: deposit DAI for a cDAI channel)

extendEndTime(uint256).notice: Extends the end time of the channel to a further date if proposed by the sender and the new time is greater than the currenct end time

forceClose().notice: Emergency function that is to be called if the recipient doesn't call the close function before the specified endTime

init(address,address,uint256,address,add.notice: Initializes state variable and can only run once when the channel is created/cloned in place of constructor

repayERC20Borrowed().notice: Repays the borrowed underlying asset of the channel if an allowance has been set for the channel contract

withdrawLoanedERC20(address,address).notice: Withdraws the ERC20 that was used to borrow against once the debt has been repaid

withdrawLoanedEth(address).notice: Withdraws the Ether that was used to borrow against once the debt has been repaid
